item.title: Report E-2024080299
item.description:
Report E-2024080299

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-15T15:13:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-24
  • City: BRYAN
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics Terminal LBY experienced a UN1903 FMB 1210-8 Quat release from a 50-gallon poly drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of product released to a 1' x 10' area of the trailer floor and a 2' x 2' area of the concrete dock. The release was believed to be caused by a pallet nail puncture. The damaged drum was placed into an 85-gallon poly overpack. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The impacted absorbents and debris were containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024080292
item.description:
Report E-2024080292

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-15T15:13:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-12
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SET Environmental was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractorâ€™s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted the pallet and top of the poly drum and estimated that five (5) ounces of material was released due to a pinhole puncture in the drum. SET Environmental personnel neutralized and cleaned up the released material. The spent absorbents and recovered material were placed into one (1) 30-gallon metal drum and was staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilization.

item.title: Report E-2024080207
item.description:
Report E-2024080207

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-14T15:13:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-07
  • City: WEBSTER
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: HAWKINS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: There was no product release, but a gassing or fuming from the mixing of the 2 products The Hawkins driver was instructed by Great Wolf Lodge personnel to deliver/pump the product in to the designated tank. Being a newly installed tank, it was not marked with the specific intended product, the driver proceeded to pump the sulfuric acid into to the tank not knowing that their was sodium hypochlorite in the tank. The mixture then fumed/gassed off leading to the evacuation of the area.

item.description:
Report E-2024080216

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-14T15:13:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-07
  • City: GRANBURY
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: GROENDYKE INVESTMENTS INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While delivering gasoline, product started to overflow the containment well. This was not a store which we monitor inventory, customer places order Station was closed, driver was unable to get Veeder Root readings to verify tank capacity. Driver did not confirm tank volume with dispatch prior to delivering. Tank overfill flaps did not engage. Tank was filled 100 gallons shy of 100% capacity

  • City: FORT WORTH

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package was found on a pallet at the end of the loading dock contained in plastic bags. A torn portion of the box with the shipping label was in the bags with 3 one gallon bottles of alcohol. SDS documents are attached. 2 bottles were Humco Denatured alcohol UN1993 and 1 was Pharmco Ethyl Alcohol 95% UN1170. The empty bottle missing its cap was Humco Denatured Alcohol.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESONDER GOT A CALL FOR A LEAKING PACKAGE AT THE IRREG BELT. RESPONDER ARRIVED ON SCENE IN FULL PPE AND FOUND A CORROSIVE HAZMAT LEAKING. AFTER CONSULTING THE DECISION TREE, HE PH TESTE THE PRODUCT AND FOUND IT WAS HIGHLY CAUSTIC. HE THEN PROCEDED TO CONTANERIZE THE SPILL TO BRING BACK TO THE DMP AREA FOR PROCESSING.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 1-gallon of Klean Stripe released from 1-gallon metal pail due to improper loading. The release impacted Dock 140. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site.
